title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics Awarded for Quantum Tech Advances
snippets: The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."
The announcement was made by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm.
Quantum mechanics is the "foundation of all digital technology," notes the chair of the Nobel Committee for Physics.
John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis have won the 2025 physics Nobel Prize for their work in quantum mechanics. It is the second Nobel Prize to be awarded this year.
The 2025 Nobel prize in physics has gone to three researchers, John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis, whose work has led to the development of today's quantum computers

Trio led experiments demonstrating that bizarre properties of quantum world can translate into measurable effects in the everyday

The Nobel prize in physics 2025 has been awarded to British, French and American scientists for their work on quantum mechanics.

John Clarke, a British phy
John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis won the Nobel Prize in Physics on Tuesday for research into quantum mechanical tunneling.

Nobel Prize in Physics will be announced Tuesday, the second award to be revealed this year by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm a day after a trio of scientists won the prize for contributions to medicine.
titles: The Nobel Prize for physics is awarded for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
Physics Nobel awarded to three scientists for work on quantum computing
Nobel Prize for Physics awarded to trio for quantum mechanics discoveries
Nobel Prize in physics goes to US-based trio for discoveries in quantum mechanics
Nobel prize for physics goes to trio behind quantum computing chips
Nobel prize in physics awarded to three scientists for work on quantum mechanics
Nobel Prize for physics goes to 3 scientists for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
The Nobel Prize in physics is to be announced Tuesday
summary: John Clarke, Michel Devoret, and John Martinis were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for their pioneering work in quantum mechanics, specifically advancing the development of quantum technology, including quantum computers, cryptography, and sensors. Their research has been crucial in demonstrating how quantum mechanics' properties can have practical applications in technology. The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm announced the award, highlighting the trio's contributions as foundational to digital technology's future.

title: Raducanu Retires from Wuhan Open Match; Alexandrova Defeats Mboko
snippets: British number one Emma Raducanu looks devoid of energy and appears to struggle with the hot and humid conditions before retiring in China.

• World No 30 struggled throughout match against Ann Li

  • Raducanu retired trailing 6-1, 4-1 after a medical timeout

Emma Raducanu’s brutal run of form and luck in Asia continued at the Wuhan Open as she retired from her first round match at the WTA 1000 event a
Emma Raducanu retired from her first-round match at the Wuhan Open against Ann Li as she struggled with the humid conditions.
Canada’s Victoria Mboko is out of the Wuhan Open tennis tournament after a 6-3, 6-2 loss to Russia’s Ekaterina Alexandrova on Monday.
titles: Raducanu retires ill in Wuhan Open first round
Listless Raducanu retires from first-round match at stiflingly hot Wuhan Open
Raducanu retires from Wuhan Open first round
Canada’s Mboko, Fernandez eliminated in first round of Wuhan Open
summary: Emma Raducanu retired from her Wuhan Open first-round match against Ann Li, trailing 6-1, 4-1, after struggling with hot and humid conditions and taking a medical timeout. The British number one looked devoid of energy throughout the match. In another match, Canada's Victoria Mboko was defeated by Russia's Ekaterina Alexandrova with scores of 6-3, 6-2.

title: Senate Rejects Funding Proposals, Federal Shutdown Continues
snippets: Democrats and Republicans traded blame for the ongoing shutdown as the Senate rejected two proposals to fund the federal government.
President Donald Trump could "start taking sharp measures" if the Senate does not pass the funding bill, White House economic advisor Kevin Hassett said.
The government shut down began at midnight on Wednesday as Democrats and Republicans appeared to be nowhere close to reaching a funding deal.
titles: US in shutdown impasse as Senate again rejects funding bill
Funding bill falls short again in Senate, extending government shutdown
Government Shutdown: Deadlocked Senate Again Fails To Pass Funding Bills As Shutdown Hits Week 2
summary: The Senate rejected two proposals to fund the federal government, continuing the shutdown that began at midnight on Wednesday. Both Democrats and Republicans blamed each other for the impasse. White House economic advisor Kevin Hassett warned that President Trump might take decisive actions if a funding deal is not reached soon.

title: Blue Jays Eye Sweep Against Yankees in Game 3 of ALDS
snippets: The Toronto Blue Jays look to take another step toward the World Series when they take on the Yankees tonight in New York.
As the Toronto Blue Jays look to sweep the American League Division Series in Game 3 tonight, some Canadian fans say they'll be cheering proudly from the stands at Yankee Stadium.

Thus far, the Blue Jays have collectively done their jobs more effectively than the Yankees, particularly during the most critical inflection points of the first two games. That’s why Toronto has a shot to wrap up the ALDS on Tuesday.
titles: Jays look to finish sweep of Yankees in ALDS
Fans head to NYC as Blue Jays look for ALDS sweep
After meeting key moments in Toronto, Blue Jays look to finish off Yankees
summary: The Toronto Blue Jays aim to secure their spot in the World Series by defeating the Yankees in Game 3 of the American League Division Series (ALDS) tonight in New York. Having outperformed the Yankees in the first two games, the Blue Jays are in a position to sweep the series. Canadian fans are expected to support their team from the stands at Yankee Stadium.

title: Amazon and Walmart Compete with Major Discounts in October Sales Event

From Bose's QuietComfort headphones to a 10-inch, octa-core Android tablet with 16GB of RAM, read on for the best tech deals during Amazon Prime's Big Deal Days 2025 event.

From Cetaphil and Calvin Klein to Dyson, Shark and Samsung. Whether you’re shopping for everyday essentials or big-ticket items, Amazon Prime Big Deal Days is the time to save.

Amazon is the retailer to beat when it comes to offering deals to compete with Amazon’s October Prime Day event. Walmart has proven to be a contender this year, matching the prices on several discounts and marking down many other tech products that we think you’ll like. Its sale event, simply called

Amazon’s October Prime Day sale (aka Prime Big Deal Days) is finally here, and we’ve collected the best deals we could find on everything from noise-canceling headphones and robot vacuums to 4K OLED TVs. Concurrently, Walmart is competing by matching several of Amazon's discounts and offering additional deals on tech products.

Specifically, Hollywood Burbank Airport in Los Angeles had no air traffic control staff for nearly six hours, leading to managed air traffic remotely and causing delays.

title: Illinois Sues Trump Administration Over National Guard Deployment
snippets: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul about President Trump's efforts to deploy National Guard forces to Chicago, over state and local objections.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxPUVhfLTJLLVpld2FXbFlueVlESHZzUGpmNkt4SXlCaHJ4cFFXZTVpWE54d3FwdVBEaG50eFB1TTZEamh5MFozUS15VFBWa2xoR0d3NG54TzZnS3VvYVFTck9xRVVJMmNVTi05Rl9kOUpRQ1NXU1BoTWF2THZ1VVRvNElfc0VkcFM3?oc=5" target="_blank">Illinois sues Trump over National Guard dep
titles: Illinois AG responds to Trump's push to send National Guard to Chicago
Illinois sues Trump over National Guard deployment to Chicago - Axios
summary: Illinois has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration, challenging the decision to deploy National Guard troops to the state, labeling it "unlawful and unconstitutional." The suit argues against the federalization of the Illinois National Guard and the deployment of out-of-state guard members, including those from Texas, claiming it threatens citizens with "military occupation." A judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration's move. California's Governor, Gavin Newsom, criticized the use of the military as political tools and announced intentions to sue as well.

Meanwhile, the Jaguars achieved a surprising win on Monday night. Heading into the sixth week of NFL action, there's anticipation for a new top team to emerge in the power rankings.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Supreme Court Appeal Declined, Transferred to Texas Camp
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifEFVX3lxTE10cURkM1huYWlic0RVWWJVQ0F1ZUprbUYzdkE3Y0VhTUZSR04yV2s4Y0hoWHlvMU9aWkRabVdpTzNxc1h0N05SUGphQUxEUEh2azBRRUFhb2xrYmY5SHBUYkFoUzYxTmthQjhyTV9nejE5OUNBZ0JsZzhNSUQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Supreme Court rejects Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell's

The Supreme Court has declined to take up the appeal of Maxwell, who was contesting her prosecution and conviction on grounds that the government had violated an agreement made with Jeffrey Epstein before his death.
Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted procurer of Jeffrey Epstein, may now focus efforts to get a pardon or sentence commutation from President Donald Trump.
titles: Supreme Court rejects Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal - Axios
WATCH:  Supreme Court denies Ghislaine Maxwell appeal
Supreme Court rejects appeal of Ghislaine Maxwell for Epstein abetting conviction
summary: Ghislaine Maxwell, associated with Jeffrey Epstein, is serving a 20-year sentence for sex trafficking and related crimes as of 2022. Her appeal to the US Supreme Court was declined. Maxwell attempted to argue her indictment was invalid due to Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement. Recently, she was transferred from a low-security prison in Florida to a minimum-security camp in Texas.

title: Search Ends for Victims of Indonesia School Collapse; Death Toll Confirmed
snippets: A search for the bodies of victims from a school collapse in Indonesia has called off after the death toll finalised.
Officials halt search at al-Khoziny school after clearing debris and determining no more bodies to be found.

Grief and confusion gripped East Java last week after foundational failures caused the Al Khoziny Islamic school to collapse during afternoon prayers

Indonesian rescuers wrapped up the search on Tuesday for victims trapped under the rubble of a
titles: Video: Search for bodies called off after Indonesia school collapse
Indonesia ends search for victims of school collapse with at least 61 dead
Indonesia school collapse: search for victims ends as 67 confirmed dead
summary: The search for victims of the Al Khoziny Islamic school collapse in East Java, Indonesia, has ended. Officials confirmed the death toll and stated no more bodies are under the debris. The collapse occurred last week during afternoon prayers, attributed to foundational failures. Rescuers concluded their efforts on Tuesday.

title: Macron Faces Limited Options as Third Premier Lost Since 2024 Elections
snippets: President’s options narrow after losing third premier since his 2024 snap elections

Édouard Philippe, a contender to succeed Macron, says situation is ‘distressing’ amid last-ditch efforts to get cross-party support for cabinet

  • Europe live – latest updates
titles: Can Macron break France’s political deadlock?
Macron should announce early election, says former PM as France’s political crisis deepens
summary: After losing his third premier since the 2024 snap elections, President Macron's options have narrowed. Édouard Philippe, a potential successor, described the situation as 'distressing' as efforts intensify to secure cross-party support for the cabinet.

title: Dodgers Beat Phillies 4-3 in NLDS Game 2, Snell Dominates
snippets: With a dominant effort from Blake Snell, a well-executed wheel play and one fortuitous scoop from Freddie Freeman for the final out, the Los Angeles Dodgers escaped with a 4-3 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on Monday in Game 2 of the NLDS.

Blake Snell stuck out nine over six shutout innings of one-hit ball for the Dodgers before relievers Alex Vesia and Roki Sasaki thwarted Philadelphia’s ninth-inning rally, sending Los Angeles to a 4-3 victory over the Phillies in Game 2 of their NL Division Series on Monday night.

Andrew Vaughn and Jackson Chourio each hit a three-run homer, William Contreras added a solo shot and the Milwaukee Brewers beat the Chicago Cubs 7-3 on Monday night to move one win from a trip to the National League Championship Series.
titles: Dodgers spin wheel play into win, 2-0 NLDS lead
Dodgers’ bullpen holds off Phillies for commanding 2-0 lead in NLDS
Misiorowski-led bullpen leads Brewers past Cubs for 2-0 lead in NLDS
summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers won 4-3 against the Philadelphia Phillies in Game 2 of the NLDS, thanks to Blake Snell's six shutout innings with nine strikeouts and one hit allowed. Key defensive plays and effective relief pitching from Alex Vesia and Roki Sasaki halted a late Phillies rally, securing the Dodgers' victory.

title: Chargers' Omarion Hampton on Injured Reserve, Haskins and Vidal to Step Up
snippets: Chargers starting running back Omarion Hampton will be placed on injured reserve due to an ankle injury, coach Jim Harbaugh said Monday.
Hassan Haskins and Kimani Vidal are next up in the Chargers' backfield
titles: Chargers placing top RB Hampton (ankle) on IR
Omarion Hampton injury update: Chargers RB (ankle) joins Najee Harris on IR, will miss at least four games
summary: The Los Angeles Chargers' starting running back, Omarion Hampton, has been placed on injured reserve due to an ankle injury, as announced by coach Jim Harbaugh. Hassan Haskins and Kimani Vidal are set to take over duties in the Chargers' backfield following Hampton's injury.

title: Mark Sanchez Charged With Felony Battery After Altercation in Indianapolis
snippets: Mark Sanchez is facing a felony battery charge over the altercation between the former NFL quarterback and a 69-year-old truck driver early Saturday in Indianapolis.

Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez is now facing a felony charge of battery involving serious bodily injury in addition to the misdemeanor charges stemming from a weekend incident in Indianapolis that led to his arrest.
titles: Sanchez now facing felony charge for altercation
Former NFL QB Mark Sanchez facing felony charge in Indianapolis altercation
summary: Former NFL quarterback and Fox Sports commentator Mark Sanchez has been charged with felony battery following an altercation with a 69-year-old truck driver in Indianapolis early Saturday.

title: Bills' Keon Coleman Benched for Discipline, Coach Seeks Consistency

McDermott wants to see 'more consistency' from the second-year wideout
titles: Bills benched WR Coleman for disciplinary reasons
Bills benched Keon Coleman for first series vs. Patriots due to disciplinary reasons, Sean McDermott reveals
summary: Buffalo Bills wide receiver Keon Coleman was benched for the first offensive series during Sunday night's game against the New England Patriots as a disciplinary action, according to head coach Sean McDermott. McDermott emphasized the need for "more consistency" from the second-year player.

Israelis mark the second anniversary of the Hamas-led attack in which 1,200 people were killed

Commemorations held in kibbutzim whose members were killed or kidnapped as Tel Aviv rally to call for hostages’ release

Israelis gathered across the country on Tuesday to mark the second anniversary of the 7 October attack, in which Hamas-led militants killed about 1,200 people and took 251

summary: Israelis marked the second anniversary of the Hamas-led attacks on 7 October, which resulted in approximately 1,200 deaths and 251 kidnappings. Commemorations took place across the country, including rallies in Tel Aviv advocating for the release of hostages still held in Gaza. Concurrently, ceasefire negotiations are underway in Egypt as fighting persists.

title: Israel-Hamas Negotiations Begin in Egypt Amid Mourning
snippets: Negotiators from Israel and Hamas are heading to Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, to start indirect talks about ending the Israel-Gaza war.
Trump urges mediators to “move fast” as key Gaza talks begin.
As Israelis brace for a day of mourning and commemoration, negotiators for Israel and Hamas met with mediators in Egypt to hash out an end to the war.
titles: What are the key sticking points in Trump's Gaza peace plan?
Will Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan Work?
Israel and Hamas Meet in Egypt to Discuss Gaza Peace Plan
summary: Negotiators from Israel and Hamas have begun indirect talks in Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, aimed at ending the Israel-Gaza war. The talks, urged by Trump to proceed quickly, coincide with a day of mourning in Israel. The negotiations are facilitated by mediators in an effort to reach a resolution.

title: Medical Helicopter Crashes on Highway 50 in Sacramento, Three Injured
snippets: There were no patients on board the helicopter, which crashed on a California highway. However, the pilot and two medical staff members were injured. Officials are investigating the cause of the crash.
A large-scale response is underway in Sacramento after a REACH Air Medical Services helicopter crashed onto Highway 50, shutting down eastbound traffic Monday night.
titles: US: Medical helicopter crashes on California highway
Medical helicopter crashes on California freeway, crew taken to area hospitals
summary: A REACH Air Medical Services helicopter crashed onto Highway 50 in Sacramento, with no patients on board. The pilot and two medical staff members sustained injuries. The crash, which occurred Monday night, prompted a significant emergency response and led to the closure of eastbound traffic. Authorities are currently investigating the cause of the incident.

title: Victims of October 7 Attacks Remembered; Peace Talks Underway in Egypt
snippets: Friends and relatives gathered at the Nova music festival site to mourn the loved ones they lost in the October 7 attacks two years ago. In Egypt, indirect talks on Trump's 20-point plan are ongoing. DW has more.
The second anniversary of the Oct. 7 attacks comes with peace talks underway, but with hostages still in Gaza, more than 67,000 Palestinians dead and Israel more isolated than ever before.
titles: Middle East updates: Israel marks October 7 anniversary
Israel Marks Two-Year Anniversary of Oct. 7 in Subdued Fashion
summary: On the second anniversary of the October 7 attacks, friends and relatives commemorated victims at the Nova music festival site. Concurrently, peace talks related to Trump's 20-point plan are happening in Egypt, amidst a backdrop of ongoing hostage situations in Gaza, over 67,000 Palestinian deaths, and increased isolation for Israel.

The move comes as Meta has been scaling back its creator payout programs over the past few years.
titles: Instagram will award top creators with a gold ring. But no cash
Instagram introduces new ‘Ring’ award for top creators
summary: Meta has announced a competition with winners selected by a panel featuring Instagram's Adam Mosseri, filmmaker Spike Lee, designer Marc Jacobs, and YouTuber Marques Brownlee. This occurs as Meta reduces its creator payout programs.
